Understate: The claim may be seen as understating the number of murders in El Paso by only mentioning the average over the last 10 years (18 murders per year) and not providing the actual number of murders on the day of the shooting.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it only provides the average number of murders over the last 10 years without providing specific data for the year in question or the number of murders on the day of the shooting.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of murders on the day of the shooting is significantly higher than the average, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the high number of murders on the day of the shooting, such as the specific circumstances of the incident or other factors that may have contributed to the increase in violence.
